endpoints.name: Create Webhook
endpoints.description: Create a new webhook. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission. Returns a [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) object on success. Webhook names follow our naming restrictions that can be found in our [Usernames and Nicknames](#DOCS_RESOURCES_USER/usernames-and-nicknames) documentation, with the following additional stipulations:

endpoints.name: Get Channel Webhooks
endpoints.description: Returns a list of channel [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) objects. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission.

endpoints.name: Get Guild Webhooks
endpoints.description: Returns a list of guild [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) objects. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission.

endpoints.name: Get Webhook
endpoints.description: Returns the new [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) object for the given id.

endpoints.name: Get Webhook with Token
endpoints.description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication and returns no user in the webhook object.

endpoints.name: Modify Webhook
endpoints.description: Modify a webhook. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission. Returns the updated [webhook](#DOCS_RESOURCES_WEBHOOK/webhook-object) object on success.

endpoints.name: Modify Webhook with Token
endpoints.description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication, does not accept a `channel_id` parameter in the body, and does not return a user in the webhook object.

endpoints.name: Delete Webhook
endpoints.description: Delete a webhook permanently. Requires the `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS` permission. Returns a `204 No Content` response on success.

endpoints.name: Delete Webhook with Token
endpoints.description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication.

endpoints.name: Execute Webhook
endpoints.description: Refer to [Uploading Files](#DOCS_REFERENCE/uploading-files) for details on attachments and `multipart/form-data` requests.

endpoints.name: Execute Slack-Compatible Webhook
endpoints.description: Refer to [Slack's documentation](https://api.slack.com/incoming-webhooks) for more information. We do not support Slack's `channel`, `icon_emoji`, `mrkdwn`, or `mrkdwn_in` properties.

endpoints.name: Execute GitHub-Compatible Webhook
endpoints.description: Add a new webhook to your GitHub repo (in the repo's settings), and use this endpoint as the "Payload URL." You can choose what events your Discord channel receives by choosing the "Let me select individual events" option and selecting individual events for the new webhook you're configuring.

endpoints.name: Get Webhook Message
endpoints.description: Returns a previously-sent webhook message from the same token. Returns a [message](#DOCS_RESOURCES_CHANNEL/message-object) object on success.

endpoints.name: Edit Webhook Message
endpoints.description:
Edits a previously-sent webhook message from the same token. Returns a [message](#DOCS_RESOURCES_CHANNEL/message-object) object on success.
When the `content` field is edited, the `mentions` array in the message object will be reconstructed from scratch based on the new content. The `allowed_mentions` field of the edit request controls how this happens. If there is no explicit `allowed_mentions` in the edit request, the content will be parsed with _default_ allowances, that is, without regard to whether or not an `allowed_mentions` was present in the request that originally created the message.
Refer to [Uploading Files](#DOCS_REFERENCE/uploading-files) for details on attachments and `multipart/form-data` requests.
Any provided files will be **appended** to the message. To remove or replace files you will have to supply the `attachments` field which specifies the files to retain on the message after edit.

endpoints.name: Delete Webhook Message
endpoints.description: Deletes a message that was created by the webhook. Returns a `204 No Content` response on success.
